intro: Inga calderonii, commonly known as the Caldeño inga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several elliptical seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various animals.
